required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Mucogyne® Ovule in Vulvovaginal Dryness Management in Women Treated by Brachytherapy and/or Radiotherapy for Endometrial or Cervical Cancer.
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Mucogyne® Ovule in Vulvovaginal Dryness Management in Women Treated by Brachytherapy and/or Radiotherapy for Endometrial or Cervical Cancer.

brief_summary.textblock:
Randomized, open-label, national (France), multicenter, prospective clinical study, to evaluate the superiority of Mucogyne® ovules over the control group on vaginal health (including hydration) in women treated by brachytherapy and/or radiotherapy for endometrial or cervical cancer.
The study will be carried out in 2 phases: the first part will focus on 80 women with endometrial cancer, an interim analysis will determine the interest of continuing or not the study (second part) on the whole targeted population (endometrial or cervical cancer).

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: In the first part of the study, 80 women with endometrial cancer will be recruited over 8 months, 40 being randomized in the Mucogyne® arm, the 40 others in the control arm.

primary_outcome.measure: Vaginal Health Index (VHI) change from inclusion to end of study
primary_outcome.description: Each parameter is evaluated from 1 (worst) to 5 (best/normal): vaginal elasticity, vaginal secretion volume, vaginal pH, epithelial mucous membrane integrity, vaginal hydration/lubrication. The sum of points for each parameter gives the VHI, from 5 (worst) to 25 (best/normal)

secondary_outcome.description: Evolution of scarring of the vaginal mucosa by a composite score: visualization of the hysterectomy scar (not visible / visible) for endometrial cancer patients OR visualization of the cervix (not visible / visible) for cervical cancer patients, presence or absence of vaginal adhesions / cohalescences (walls and bottom of the vagina ), collapse of adhesions to touch (Y / N), edema / redness of vaginal mucosa (indicative of inflammation), pain caused by pressure (Y / N), bleeding caused by contact (none / moderate / severe)

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to additional local treatment administration
Patient Global Impression of Change (PGIC) on vaginal health
secondary_outcome.description: Auto-evaluation: score from 1 (very much improved) to 7 (very much worse) on vaginal health related to the study intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Symptoms (pain, dyspareunia, vaginal pruritis, vulvovaginal dryness) evolution
secondary_outcome.description: Auto-evaluation of the symptoms: pain, dyspareunia, vaginal pruritis, vulvovaginal dryness on Visual Analogic Scale (VAS) of 10mm Patient indicates where she locates the intensity of the symptom from 0mm (no symptom) to 10mm (worst intensity)

Each parameter is evaluated from 1 (worst) to 5 (best/normal): vaginal elasticity, vaginal secretion volume, vaginal pH, epithelial mucous membrane integrity, vaginal hydration/lubrication. The sum of points for each parameters gives the VHI, from 5 (worst) to 25 (best/normal)
Measured on vaginal sample collected at inclusion, 1 month and 3 months
Complications and adverse events related to study intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient satisfaction questionnaire at the end of study
secondary_outcome.description: All patients (both arms) will be asked about their satisfaction on the treatment of their vulvogainal symptoms during the study will be assessed using a 5-point Likert scale : "At the end of this study, how would you rate your level of satisfaction with the treatment of your vulvovaginal symptoms? Very satisfactory / Satisfactory / Moderate / Poor / Very Poor"

arm_group.description: The dosage during the study will be 1 Mucogyne® ovule per day at bedtime for 10 days and then 1 ovule every 2 days until the end of the 3-month follow-up.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Woman over 18
- For the first phase of the study (first 80 patients): hysterectomized patient with endometrial cancer (stage I, stage II and histological type I, without chemotherapy, with brachytherapy and/or radiotherapy)
- For the second phase of the study (142 following patients): patient with endometrial cancer (stage I, stage II and histological type I, hysterectomized without chemotherapy, with brachytherapy and/or radiotherapy) or with cervical cancer (stage 1B2 to 3B with or without chemotherapy, with brachytherapy and/or radiotherapy)
- Vulvovaginal dryness confirmed by VHI <15
- Patient capable of receiving and understanding information related to the study, giving informed written consent, and easily completing a quality of life questionnaire
- Patient affiliated to the French social security system
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patient with clinically observed vulvovaginal infections
- Patient with endometrial cancer treated with chemotherapy
- Patient already participating in another study
- Patient under legal protection, or under guardianship or curatorship
- For the second phase of the study (142 following patients) and only for patients with cervical cancer: pregnancy (pregnancy test to be performed if premenopausal)

facility.name: Institut de Cancerologie de Lorraine - Site 004
